div.p: Well-learned, pious, honorable, and wise, especially gracious, dear lord and good friend. I have received and understood your letter addressed to me, and I thank you most kindly for the good, indeed divine comfort you have given me in the aforementioned letter, through which I continually perceive your favor, good will, and good intentions towards me.

With the assurance that, as for my person, I can always owe and deserve good will towards you and yours, you will find me willing and ready, with the help of Almighty God; may He keep you in long life and health.
Also, I thank you sincerely for the little book about the Turks, which you sent me, and which I will gladly read as soon as I have the opportunity.
For recent news, my dear lord and godfather Johann Haller will inform you of what we have here. Your ever willing servant, Johann Steiger.
To the highly and well-learned, pious, and wise lord, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, my gracious dear lord and good friend. Zurich.
